class_notes: The delivery format listed for this class is based on current university guidelines.  However, if there are further changes to the COVID19 guidelines for Fall 2021 or other acts beyond our control, the school reserves the right the modify the delivery method for this class
course_description: During this course we will study primary fixed income securities such as bonds (Treasury, corporate, municipal, foreign bonds, etc), as well as structured finance fixed income such as mortgage backed securities, asset backed securities,  CMOs, CDOs, and credit default swaps (CDSs).   Although the material may get advanced and mathematical at times, this course has been specifically designed for an undergraduate student with no prior background into fixed income.
prerequisites: FIN 320 or SPECSTUBUS students or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
